translation.en: [Steven] On this hunt, I'm hitting the big island of Hawaii
with my buddy, Ryan "O-Cal" Callaghan…
Feels like a fishy day!
…and a lifelong hunter and angler named Danny Bolton.
translation.ko: 사냥과 낚시에 잔뼈가 굵은 대니 볼턴이 함께합니다

translation.en: [whispers] There's some coming behind that tree.
translation.ko: 저 나무 뒤로 몇 마리가 오네요

translation.en: [Steven] We'll be working this place from the mountain to the sea
in search of fine local ingredients.
[Danny] There are goats everywhere.
[Steven] Grab your flip-flops.
-[theme music playing] -I'm Steven Rinella.
To me, hunting isn't only about the pursuit of an animal.
translation.ko: 제게 사냥은 단순히 동물을 잡는 게 아닙니다

translation.en: -[grunts] -[Steven] Get out of the way!
It's about who we are and what we're made of.
I live to hunt and hunt to live. I am a meat eater.
translation.ko: 전 사냥하기 위해 살고 살기 위해 사냥합니다 전 미트 이터입니다

translation.en: You might think a tiny group of islands in the middle of the Pacific Ocean
translation.ko: 하와이는 태평양 한가운데 있는 작은 제도이니

translation.en: would be pretty limited when it comes to terrestrial wild game,
translation.ko: 육상 동물은 많이 잡지 않는다고 생각하실지도 모르지만

translation.en: but in fact, hunting is a significant part of traditional Hawaiian lifestyle.
translation.ko: 사실 하와이 전통 생활 양식에서 사냥은 매우 중요한 부분입니다

translation.en: For centuries, explorers and settlers have been bringing
non-native species here in droves.
So much so that now,
with no natural predators to keep their populations in check,
translation.ko: 이들의 개체 수를 조절해 줄 천적도 없는 환경이다 보니

translation.en: animals we typically think of as domestic have spilled out into the wild.
translation.ko: 보통은 가축으로 기르는 이런 녀석들이 야생에 잔뜩 퍼졌고

translation.en: Hawaii is full of them.
They've got feral chickens, feral turkeys,
feral cattle, pigs, sheep and lots of feral goats.
translation.ko: 야생 소, 야생 돼지, 야생 양 야생 염소도 엄청나게 많죠

translation.en: The goats have been here hundreds of years.
translation.ko: 염소는 여기 들어온 지 수백 년이나 됐죠?

translation.en: Yeah, yeah, since, like, the white man came over, Captain Cook and all those guys,
translation.ko: 네, '캡틴 쿡'을 위시한 백인 탐험가들이 처음 왔을 때

translation.en: they brought the goats on the ships and then they--
And that was the beginning of it.
And the pigs predate those by hundreds and hundreds of years.
translation.ko: 그리고 돼지는 염소보다 수백 년 전에 들어왔고요

translation.en: I mean, who knows if it was the first Polynesians,
but they were here with the Polynesians,
so it's hard to say who, you know, is the local, right?
translation.ko: 그래서 정확히 '여기 출신'이 뭔지 말하기가 어렵죠

translation.en: -Yeah. Not me. -[laughing]
[Steven] What all this means from a hunting perspective is that in Hawaii,
translation.ko: 이걸 사냥의 관점에서 생각해 보면 하와이라는 곳은

translation.en: the wild game offerings are remarkably similar
translation.ko: 동네 정육점에서 볼 수 있는 동물들을

translation.en: to what you might find at your local butcher shop.
translation.ko: 전부 사냥터에서 만날 수 있는 곳입니다

translation.en: Naturally, I don't get very many opportunities
to harvest meat of that sort,
so when I was invited to come to Hawaii's Big Island on the Kona Coast
translation.ko: 이들이 저를 하와이섬 코나 해안으로 초대하여

translation.en: to hunt for some wild goats, my interest was piqued.
translation.ko: 염소 사냥을 하러 가자고 했을 때 당연히 구미가 당겼죠

translation.en: Cal and I are terribly novice when it comes to Hawaiian-style goat hunting,
translation.ko: 하와이 방식의 염소 사냥에 관해 저와 캘은 완전히 문외한이니

translation.en: so we've joined up with Cal's friend Danny Bolton to show us around.
translation.ko: 캘의 친구 대니 볼턴을 초대하여 안내를 부탁했습니다

translation.en: What's a close shot and a long shot for goats, from your experience?
translation.ko: 대니는 염소 사냥을 할 때 어느 정도 거리에서 쏴요?

translation.en: Ten yards is a close shot and then a long shot--
As you can see it's real open, so it's kind of up to you
translation.ko: 사실 방해물만 없다면 언제든 쏴도 돼요

translation.en: how far you wanna shoot.
But for me, like, I'm not gonna wanna shoot more than 40 today.
translation.ko: 하지만 저는 오늘은 36m보다 멀면 쏘지 않을 거예요

translation.en: So you'd like to just, like, find 'em moving and then try to move out in front of 'em?
translation.ko: 어디로 가는지 파악하고 먼저 가서 기다리기도 하나요?

translation.en: Yeah, for me. Like, if we can find what direction they're moving, and we'll see them coming,
translation.ko: 네, 이동 방향만 파악하면 어느 정도 예상이 되니까

translation.en: then we can use all these hills
and the terrain to work our way in front of 'em.
translation.ko: 지형을 활용해서 먼저 자리 잡고 기다릴 수 있어요

translation.en: And best if we can just have them come to us,
translation.ko: 저희 쪽으로 오게 만드는 게 가장 좋긴 해요

translation.en: 'cause then you're not moving, right?
I'm-- I'm just excited about having the, uh, ocean as a boundary, basically.
translation.ko: 난 일단 바다가 있어서 경계를 지어주니까 참 좋아

translation.en: That's a pretty unmistakable landmark.
translation.ko: 절대 헷갈릴 수 없는 표지가 되잖아

translation.en: Yeah. Yeah, so, like, everything,
when we explain stuff here in the islands, it's like
mauka and makai.
So "mauka" is the mountain and then "makai" is the ocean,
so if you gotta explain directions to somebody,
translation.ko: 예를 들어 누군가에게 방향을 설명할 때는

translation.en: you just base it off where the ocean is.
That's why a lot of people,
translation.ko: 그래서 여기 사람들이 본토로 갔을 때…

translation.en: when they go to the mainland, they get kind of a little lost too, you know?
translation.ko: 그래서 여기 사람들이 본토로 갔을 때… 길을 자주 잃어

translation.en: 'Cause they have these super obvious visual markers?
translation.ko: 거기는 눈에 띄는 표지물이 너무 많으니까요?

translation.en: It's so easy here to know which direction to face.
translation.ko: 여기는 방향을 파악하는 게 굉장히 쉽거든요

translation.en: Yeah, and you go downhill, you're gonna hit water at some point. Yeah.
translation.ko: 맞아, 경사를 따라 내려가면 언젠가는 바다가 나오니까

translation.en: All right, I'm gonna go this way.
And we're gonna go this way.
Good luck!
[Steven] In order for both of us to be hunting at once,
Cal heads off solo to one end of the ranch
translation.ko: 캘은 혼자서 사냥터의 한쪽 끝으로 가고

translation.en: while Danny and I go to hunt the other side.
Danny was born and raised on the Kona Coast
and engages in most of the activities that mainlanders like me envy about this place.
translation.ko: 저 같은 본토 출신들이 부러워해 마지않는 다양한 활동을 마음껏 즐기며 자랐습니다

translation.en: He hunts, spearfishes, regular fishes,
translation.ko: 사냥도 하고 작살로 고기도 잡고, 낚시도 하고

translation.en: and is an all-around, generally capable guy.
translation.ko: 전반적으로 못하는 게 없는 만능 재주꾼이죠

translation.en: He built his own house, even makes his own knives.
translation.ko: 자기 집도 직접 짓고 칼도 직접 만드는 데다

translation.en: Even the dude's day job is enviable.
Get this, he trains special forces soldiers in off-road driving.
translation.ko: 특수 부대 군인들에게 오프로드 운전을 가르치고 있죠

translation.en: Danny's arranged this goat hunt for Cal and me on this private ranch
translation.ko: 대니가 캘과 저를 데려온 이곳은 사유지 사냥터로서

translation.en: where cattle are regarded as good and welcome,
translation.ko: 소를 공략하기 매우 좋은 곳이지만 염소 떼는 그렇지가 않습니다

translation.en: but the hordes of wild goats, not so much.
The property owner turns lemons into lemonade, so to speak,
by leasing hunting rights to an outfitter who charges a day fee to chase the goats.
translation.ko: 사냥권 판매를 장비 판매점에 위탁하였는데 그들은 날짜별로 요금을 매기죠

translation.en: Otherwise, regulations are pretty much nonexistent.
translation.ko: 그것만 빼면 다른 규정은 없다시피 합니다

translation.en: No bag limits, no closed season,
translation.ko: 장비 제한도 없고 폐장 기간도 없고

translation.en: and I'm allowed to shoot either a male or female,
translation.ko: 사냥감도 제한이 없어서 암컷, 수컷을 가리지 않고

translation.en: or rather a billy or a nanny.
translation.ko: 빌리와 내니를 모두 잡을 수 있죠

translation.en: There's so many, it almost seems there's something wrong.
translation.ko: 개체 수가 너무 많아서 어딘가 수상할 지경입니다

translation.en: Earlier I mentioned the local butcher shop.
Hunting here isn't as easy as going to one,
translation.ko: 물론 정육점에 가서 사는 게 손쉽긴 하겠지만

translation.en: but it doesn't look to be too far off.
Oh, man, there's a million of 'em!
Look at that. Well, not a million, but 20.
You feel that wind though?
-[Steven] Yeah. -Kind of blowing right at 'em.
translation.ko: - 네 - 딱 저쪽으로 부는 것 같네요

translation.en: What are you thinking, Steve? Like--
You wanna try pick out a big billy out of there?
[Steven] Oh, I don't care. Like, the best ones to eat are the small ones, right?
translation.ko: 저는 이것도 괜찮아요 사실 먹기에는 작은 놈이 좋잖아요

translation.en: [Danny] Yeah.
-We can see what we get into. -Yeah.
But we'd have to do something about the wind, right?
[Danny] We just gotta watch which way they're going
so we're not just chasing 'em the whole time.
-Oh, yeah. -But they will eventually stop.
[Cal] Good start to the morning.
Goats pretty much everywhere.
It's gorgeous.
This terrain looks like you can just, like, pick up and run through it,
translation.ko: 여기는 지형만 봤을 땐 바로 달려갈 수 있을 듯하지만

translation.en: but in this tall grass, there's a lot, like, rolling, loose lava rock.
translation.ko: 풀이 길게 자라 있고 화산암이 여기저기 굴러다녀서

translation.en: So it's probably gonna be a little slower than you want it to be,
translation.ko: 생각보다는 빨리 못 갈 것 같아요

translation.en: but they're in a good spot to pick one out.
translation.ko: 그래도 지금 위치가 좋으니 일단 한 놈 고르면

translation.en: That'll be the game.
Ah. There's this group that's coming up the draw,
translation.ko: 저쪽에 있는 무리가 이쪽 골짜기로 오고 있는데

translation.en: and if they pick a direction,
should be easy to work with this wind and cut 'em off.
translation.ko: 바람을 이용해서 쉽게 파고들 수 있을 거예요

translation.en: [Steven] As you'd expect with goats all over the place,
it doesn't take us long to get in on them.
[whispering] Right there.
[Danny] I feel like if we just creep up right here…
[Steven] Trees are few and far between,
but the tall grass is enough to give me plenty of cover for a stealthy approach.
translation.ko: 수풀이 길게 자라 있어서 들키지 않고 접근할 수 있습니다

translation.en: But the grass also hides the goats.
translation.ko: 하지만 수풀이 염소까지 가려 버린 탓에

translation.en: Often they're super close,
but you can't see anything besides their ears and horns
or just a wisp of hair along the top of their back.
translation.ko: 염소 등에 난 털 몇 가닥밖에 없군요

translation.en: Not only that, the wind is still an issue.
It keeps shifting and swirling, and eventually, it betrays me.
translation.ko: 계속 방향을 바꾸며 휘몰아치더니 결국 저를 배신했죠

translation.en: They spook.
They didn't come up far enough?
No, everything spooking before its getting to it.
translation.ko: 아니요, 거리 안에 들어오기 전에 겁먹고 도망갔어요

translation.en: [chuckles] Yeah.
The wind kind of-- the wind kind of switched on.
Yeah, the wind switched bad.
Thankfully, there's no shortage of animals.
[Danny whispers] There's some coming right behind that tree.
translation.ko: 저 나무 뒤로 몇 마리가 오네요

translation.en: [Steven] We don't even have to move before we spot the next group.
translation.ko: 바로 그 자리에서 또 다른 염소 떼를 발견했죠

translation.en: -[whispering] See? -Oh, that's new ones!
Oh, right there. He's right there.
Okay, so maybe I need to be a little more cautious than that.
translation.ko: 네, 아무래도 조금 더 조심스럽게 해야 할 것 같습니다

translation.en: -[whispering] That was close. -[laughs] I was gonna range.
translation.ko: 잡을 뻔했는데 - 탐색을 해보려던 참이었어요 - 8마리쯤 됐을걸요

translation.en: -I think there were about eight. -I saw how close they were.
translation.ko: - 탐색을 해보려던 참이었어요 - 8마리쯤 됐을걸요 너무 가까이 있길래

translation.en: I was like, I don't need to range find 'em.
That was exciting.
[chuckles] Let's go check the ones that don't-- don't know we're here.
translation.ko: 우리가 온 걸 모르는 녀석을 찾아보죠

translation.en: [Steven] Meanwhile, while I'm spooking goats left and right,
translation.ko: 제가 여기저기서 염소를 겁주고 다닐 동안

translation.en: Cal is doing his own thing.
[whispering] We got the wind sort of circled down and around.
There's a bunch of goats coming up this draw right here.
translation.ko: 저쪽에 있는 염소 떼가 이쪽 골짜기로 오고 있으니까

translation.en: So I figured getting set up,
see if we can get a crack at the very first ones,
and if not, we can just sit there
translation.ko: 여의치 않으면 그냥 여기 자리 잡고

translation.en: and the rest will come through.
That's the theory.
Just like shooting fish in the ocean. Works every time.
translation.ko: 바다에서 고기를 잡을 때랑 똑같죠 항상 먹히는 방법이에요

translation.en: These goats are feeding everywhere.
translation.ko: 지금은 염소가 사방에서 풀을 뜯고 있고

translation.en: And there's some working up this way.
It'd be very advantageous if I could stay put and let them come to me.
translation.ko: 녀석들이 먼저 오길 기다리는 게 확실히 유리하긴 해요

translation.en: Or I'm gonna get bored, and I'm gonna start crawling that way.
translation.ko: 그사이에 제가 따분해져서 저쪽으로 갈 수도 있고요

translation.en: Perfect eating-size goats.
Super great stalk.
Had a really nice shot at a nanny,
but just waiting for things to calm down to go to look for blood and do the thing.
translation.ko: 일단 진정될 때까지 기다리다가 가서 핏자국이 있는지 보자고요

translation.en: Fingers crossed.
That's blood.
And that's blood.
Oh, yeah.
Look at that tiny little thing. Little mama goat.
translation.ko: 이 녀석 좀 보세요 엄마 염소네요

translation.en: Okay, then.
Looking forward to checking out how this meat is
and couldn't ask for a better view for the pack out.
translation.ko: 게다가 짐 싸기 딱 좋은 풍경이잖아요

translation.en: [Steven] While Cal had better success on his first stalk,
Danny and I aren't exactly short on opportunities.
translation.ko: 대니와 저도 금방 다시 기회를 잡았습니다

translation.en: We're right back on top of a grazing herd.
translation.ko: 풀을 뜯는 염소 떼를 바로 발견했죠

translation.en: [whispering] There's more down the gully.
There's probably some even closer than that one.
translation.ko: 저기 있는 게 더 가까운 것 같아요

translation.en: [Steven] Yeah, I bet.
I think the wind is good right now.
[Steven] I think we should nudge down there a little more.
[Danny] I think so.
[Steven] After a short push, I'm in position again.
translation.ko: 조금 더 앞으로 가서 자리를 잡았습니다

translation.en: It was a definite hit on a nanny,
but I lost sight of her through the tall grass.
translation.ko: 수풀이 너무 길어서 정확히 못 봤습니다

translation.en: [whispering] Yeah, you seen her bend down right along--
-It spun as I shot. -Yeah.
translation.ko: 제가 딱 쏠 때 고개를 돌렸어요

translation.en: I know. I wanna see what happens here.
Yeah, I would say we give her a little time if we can.
translation.ko: 네, 하지만 조금만 더 기다려 보죠

translation.en: [Steven] Yeah.
[Danny] But she's hurt.
[Steven] Because she moved and spun just as I shot,
translation.ko: 제가 시위를 놓을 때 몸을 돌려 움직였으니

translation.en: we think it might not be immediately lethal.
translation.ko: 즉사에 이르는 치명상은 아닐 수도 있습니다

translation.en: We want to give it a minute so as to not bump her unnecessarily.
translation.ko: 성급하게 녀석의 눈에 띄지 않도록 조금 더 기다렸죠

translation.en: After a bit, we make our slow approach to look for a blood trail.
translation.ko: 잠시 후 우리는 핏자국을 찾아서 천천히 다가갔습니다

translation.en: There's some blood right here.
-I mean, she's bleeding pretty good. -[Steven] Yeah.
I feel like she's down, and we just can't see her.
translation.ko: 쓰러진 것 같긴 한데 안 보이네요

translation.en: [Steven] Eventually, we track her down, and my suspicion was correct.
translation.ko: 자취를 따라가 보니 제 예상이 맞았습니다

translation.en: [Danny whispers] There she is right there.
[Steven] I need to shoot a second time.
[Danny] Yeah, she's done.
Oh, yeah. That's a beauty.
-In terms of, uh, sheep, goats and pigs. -Yeah.
Do goats sit at the bottom in terms of preferred?
-People like pigs better than goats? -Yeah.
-Yeah, they like sheep better than goats? -I think so.
Just goats are goaty.
-[chuckles] Goats are goaty. -Yeah.
Currently, do people still raise goats here?
-Yeah. -They do? Yeah?
So you got your, like, feral goats and domestic?
translation.ko: 그럼 염소는 야생도 있고 가축도 있는 거예요?

translation.en: Yeah, and a lot of people catch the wild ones.
-Oh, make a herd? -Yeah.
So my friend caught a baby one and then she tamed it.
translation.ko: 제 친구는 새끼 염소를 잡아서 길들였어요

translation.en: So she'll take it hunting with her
and, dude, that thing's, like gold.
-Use it as a decoy. -Yeah!
All the other goats are like, "Hey!"
-Really? Like a Judas goat. -[laughs] Yeah.
You can clean her any way you want.
-You see how I go right down the back? -Let's see how you do it.
translation.ko: - 저는 보통 등부터 해요 - 한번 보여주세요

translation.en: [Danny] First knife I ever made.
[Steven] Oh, you made that? That's a cool knife.
So if, uh, we get a chance to go fishing, what are we gonna fish for?
translation.ko: 보통 낚시하러 갈 때는 어떤 고기를 잡으세요?

translation.en: I kind of wanna just see what's biting,
but if I had a guess, it would be for wahoo.
translation.ko: 하지만 하나 꼽자면 꼬치삼치라고 할 수 있겠네요

translation.en: -Oh, really? -We call 'em ono.
-Ono is like-- -I would like to see that.
translation.ko: - 저는 오노를… - 저도 한번 보고 싶네요

translation.en: [Danny] That's my favorite, you know?
If we're going for the surf and turf, we've got the turf taken care of.
translation.ko: 서프 앤 터프를 만들 거면 - 네 - 일단 육고기는 확보했네요

translation.en: Oh, I would love to see some of these fish, man.
So with the goat in the bag, we head back to rejoin Cal.
translation.ko: 염소를 가방에 넣고 다시 캘과 합류하러 갑니다

translation.en: -[Danny] Buddy! -No lack of goats.
[chuckles] No lack of goats?
-[Steven] Is that a male or female? -Female.
-Awesome shooting. -[Cal] Oh, it was fun.
Like, once you get in the grass, you're pretty invisible.
translation.ko: 일단 풀숲 안에 들어가면 모습이 전혀 안 보이더라고

translation.en: Yeah, you can get away with a lot. It's quiet too.
translation.ko: 맞아, 많은 게 가려지고 소리도 잘 안 들리지

translation.en: Yeah, but that was-- that was great.
Ready to get out of here? It's getting hot.
[chuckles] It is. Yeah. Yep!
[Steven] When mainlanders think about fishing in Hawaii,
thoughts usually go to offshore trolling,
where you drag flashy lures at high speeds through warm water
translation.ko: 따뜻한 바다에서 화려한 미끼를 재빨리 움직이며

translation.en: in pursuit of speed-demon fish that are good enough to eat raw.
translation.ko: 질주하는 고기를 잡아 생으로 먹는 장면을 떠올리실 겁니다

translation.en: Feels like a fishy day!
[Steven] Or at least that's what I think of,
though I've never actually gotten to do it.
But that's what we're gonna do today on Danny's boat,
translation.ko: 하지만 오늘 대니의 배에서 처음으로 도전하게 됐습니다

translation.en: which I'll point out is the same boat his grandfather used to fish from.
translation.ko: 참고로 이 배는 대니의 할아버지가 낚시에 쓰시던 배입니다

translation.en: As for those tea leaves,
it's a Hawaiian belief that they bring good luck to your endeavors.
translation.ko: 도전에 운이 따른다고 하와이 사람들은 믿는답니다

translation.en: -[Cal] Are we fishing yet? -No.
-Now we're fishing. -[Cal] Oh, now we're fishing! Whoo-hoo-hoo!
[Steven] The most striking thing about trolling for wahoo,
translation.ko: 대니가 가장 좋아하는 물고기인 꼬치삼치를 트롤링할 때는

translation.en: which is Danny's preferred quarry, is how damn fast you go.
translation.ko: 대니가 가장 좋아하는 물고기인 꼬치삼치를 트롤링할 때는 빨리 가는 게 중요합니다

translation.en: You could ski behind this boat.
translation.ko: 수상 스키를 탈 수 있을 만큼 빨리 배를 몰아야

translation.en: That a wahoo can catch it says something remarkable about the fish.
translation.ko: 꼬치삼치가 미끼를 물 겁니다 그만큼 대단한 녀석이죠

translation.en: It's Hawaiian name, ono, also says something about it.
It translates as "delicious."
There's always a lot of excitement when you're setting up to troll
translation.ko: 트롤링을 준비할 때는 언제나 가슴이 뜁니다

translation.en: and catching fish is a hoot,
but what comes in between those things can get monotonous.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 사이에는 지루한 시간을 견뎌내야 합니다

translation.en: So how many yards back does that run?
Right now we've got a runner about a hundred yards out. Yeah.
You need to give the boat and the bait room to do their thing,
translation.ko: 고기가 잡히려면 미끼와 배에 시간을 좀 줘야 하니

translation.en: so the angler at times just needs to sit and watch the rods and shut up.
translation.ko: 그동안 낚시꾼들은 가만히 앉아서 조용히 낚싯대만 보고 있어야겠죠

translation.en: That first fish of the day, kind of a critical one.
translation.ko: 그날 첫 번째로 걸리는 물고기가 정말 중요해

translation.en: If you don't get that one, you wind up not getting anything. -You know? -[chuckles] Yeah.
translation.ko: 그놈을 못 잡으면 그날은 완전히 허탕 친다는 거지?

translation.en: -[Danny] You're on, boys! -[reel clicking]
[Cal] Whoo! We're fishing!
That is a cool-looking fish, dude.
[Danny] That's what we came for.
-Hello, boys! -Oh, man.
-[Steven] Is that a big one? -[Danny] That's like your average size.
That's like 18 pounds.
Look at that dorsal fin has a little hideaway.
translation.ko: 등지느러미가 안 보이게 숨길 수도 있네요

translation.en: [Cal] Oh, he's like a bullet.
-[laughs] -[Steven] That is badass!
When the first ono hits the ice, I am into it.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 오노를 얼음에 넣은 후 본격적으로 시작해봅니다

translation.en: [Cal] All right, baby!
[Steven] You couldn't drag me away now.
translation.ko: 이젠 아무도 절 막을 수 없죠

translation.en: -[Cal] Yeah, buddy! -[Danny] Take your time, boys.
[Steven] I gotta remember though, not to get too cocky.
-[Danny] Go, go, go, go, go! -[Cal] Is he in?
-That was a pretty rookie mistake, huh? -[Danny] It happens.
translation.ko: - 진짜 초보적인 실수였죠? - 그럴 수 있어요

translation.en: I grabbed the leader then gave the fish room to get down in the prop.
translation.ko: 목줄을 잡았는데 공간이 떠서 고기가 프로펠러 밑으로 갔어요

translation.en: So the prop cut the line, but it was very preventable.
translation.ko: 프로펠러에 낚싯줄이 끊겼죠 이런 걸 실수하면 안 되는데

translation.en: Turns out it was even worse than I thought.
translation.ko: 게다가 제 생각보다 결과는 더 끔찍했습니다

translation.en: One of our camera guys up on the crow's nest
said he saw a gush of blood at the moment that I cut the line.
translation.ko: 망대에서 지켜보던 카메라 감독님이 알려줬는데 낚싯줄이 끊어질 때 피가 엄청나게 나왔다는군요

translation.en: I had dragged the fish into the prop,
killing it and losing it.
Dude, I'm sorry, man.
[Danny] Hey, that was your fish too. Let's get this one in.
translation.ko: 어차피 스티브 고기였잖아요 이건 확실히 잡자고요

translation.en: -[Cal] We're in the ono business now. -Good job, Callaghan.
translation.ko: - 오노 장사 시작해도 되겠다 - 훌륭해, 캘러헌

translation.en: [Danny] That's a nice one.
[Cal] Steve's in deep contemplation.
[Danny] Steve's really beating himself up.
Like any good fisherman should.
Dude, we'd have three fish in that box, man.
translation.ko: 그래도 어창에 물고기가 세 마리나 있다고

translation.en: [Steven] Unforgivable mistakes aside, we've still got two nice ono in the pot.
translation.ko: 끔찍한 실수는 저질르긴 했지만 그래도 상태 좋은 오노를 두 마리 잡았습니다

translation.en: Happy with that haul, we set out the next day in search of something new.
translation.ko: 일단 그걸로 만족하고 다음 날 새로운 고기를 찾아 나섰죠

translation.en: That something new is gray snapper,
which admittedly is not one of Danny's go-to species for rod and reel angling.
translation.ko: 솔직히 대니는 이 고기를 낚시로 잡는 걸 좋아하지 않습니다

translation.en: And to be honest, I can't really explain why I'm so gung-ho on catching one.
translation.ko: 그런데 제가 왜 이렇게 간절한지 솔직히 저도 잘 모르겠습니다

translation.en: I've just heard about them enough
that I wanna get my hands on one or rather my fork on one.
translation.ko: 꼭 제 손으로, 아니면 제 낚싯대로 잡아보고 싶었죠

translation.en: Supposedly, they're one of the best tasting fish out there.
translation.ko: 게다가 여기서 나오는 생선 중 가장 맛있다고 합니다

translation.en: Good enough to eat raw. Hawaiians call them uku.
This is the great gamble of, uh, bait in the ocean, right?
translation.ko: 바다낚시에 미끼를 쓰는 건 엄청난 도박이지?

translation.en: -It's like it's all tasty stuff. -[Steven] Yeah.
[Cal] And you're hoping to upgrade.
[Steven] To catch 'em, you gotta drop down to the ocean floor
at depths ranging from 75 feet out to a few hundred feet.
They'll hit a variety of things, but I'm using squid, octopus
translation.ko: 여러 가지가 걸리겠지만 저는 오징어, 문어와 잡어를 미끼로 쓰고 있습니다

translation.en: and chunks of bait fish.
translation.ko: 저는 오징어, 문어와 잡어를 미끼로 쓰고 있습니다

translation.en: Get 'em, Steve! Ukus!
A lot of little buggers down there tapping on me.
With live bait like that bouncing around near the bottom,
translation.ko: 이런 생미끼로 바다 바닥을 자꾸 건드리다 보면

translation.en: it's a bit of a crapshoot as to what you'll hook into.
translation.ko: 어떤 고기가 걸릴지 잘 알 수 없습니다

translation.en: [Cal] Oh!
-[Steven] You get a bump? -[Cal] Yeah.
Triggerfish! No!
Hey, look at that. Nice goatfish, buddy.
-[Steven] Nice, man! -[Danny] That's awesome, dude.
-Steve, you got something? -[Steven] Trigger.
Of course, some fish are less inclined than others to go quietly.
translation.ko: 물론 물고기 중에는 좀 소란스러운 놈들도 있습니다

translation.en: -[shouts] -[Danny] Uh-oh.
-Did he bite you? -[Steven] Yeah.
[Danny laughs] Well, do you blame him?
[Cal] Somebody grabbed a chunk of my octopus! Robbed me!
translation.ko: 누가 내 문어를 훔쳐 갔어요 이런 도둑놈!

translation.en: [Steven] It's not a trigger. That might be the target species, man.
translation.ko: 최소한 쥐치는 아니에요 목표로 한 놈은 아닐 수 있지만

translation.en: Come on, gray snapper!
[chuckles] That doesn't look gray snapper to you? [Danny] It looks gray, but it looks too wide.
translation.ko: - 회색 도미 같지는 않죠? - 회색이긴 한데 너무 넓적하네요

translation.en: [Steven] Shark.
Let's get a little bit deeper here. We'll find them ukus.
This is the spot, boys. Let's make them dreams come true.
translation.ko: 바로 여깁니다 꿈을 현실로 이뤄 보자고요

translation.en: -[Cal] That's a snappery looking fish. -[Steven] Yeah, I'll take that.
A commonality among all of them is that they all have interesting chompers.
translation.ko: 이 녀석들은 전부 주둥이 모양이 신기하더군요

translation.en: [Steven chuckles] That's a big freakin' trigger, man.
Despite the mixed bag of goatfish, a few types of triggerfish
translation.ko: 쥐치도 몇 종류 잡고 노랑촉수도 몇 마리 잡고

translation.en: and a couple of species the Hawaiians refer to as hinalea and nabeta,
those uku that we're after still elude us.
[Danny] I think Steve's lost it. The gray snapper.
He's gotta get the gray snapper.
I was just trying to think about why I care that much about catching a gray snapper.
translation.ko: 회색 도미에 왜 이렇게 집착하는지 저도 잘 모르겠어요

translation.en: I guess just something about the name.
-Or something struck me. -[Danny] Just gotta catch the uku.
translation.ko: 그냥 이름에 꽂혀서 이러나 봐요 우쿠를 잡아야 하는데

translation.en: [Steven] Yeah, I don't know, man.
[Cal and Steven] There he is!
Oh, come to papa, man!
That was him, man. That was definitely him.
That was a bait stealer right there. He's in the zone, Cal.
translation.ko: 미끼만 먹고 도망갔어요 솜씨가 진짜 훌륭해, 캘

translation.en: It seems some fish really wanna play hard to get.
translation.ko: 보아하니 물고기들이 밀고 당기기를 즐기는 듯합니다

translation.en: -You on to 'em? -Yep!
-[Steven] Oh, you are? -[Cal] Yep!
I got myself something.
He come unbuttoned right there.
-[Steven] He did? -Yeah.
[Steven] Aww.
-[Danny] Did he come off? -He took the big boy too. Son of a gun.
translation.ko: - 이런 - 도망갔어? 얘도 큰 걸 물고 도망갔어 빌어먹을!

translation.en: It was not someone messing around.
But these fish don't know who they're dealing with.
We'll stay out here all night if we have to.
translation.ko: 밤을 새워서라도 꼭 잡고 말 테니까요

translation.en: Oh, good connection!
[Danny] He's on!
[Cal] Come on, baby.
Come on. Come on!
-[Danny] Oh! -Ooh! That's a promising color.
-Yeah! Oh, no, it's not a gray snapper. -[cheering]
translation.ko: 좋았어! 아니, 아니네 회색 도미가 아니야

translation.en: -[Danny] Yeah, it is. -[Steven] Oh, it is? Oh, get him!
[Steven] Yes, it is!
-[Danny] That's the one! That's him. -That's him!
-I'd recognize that fish anywhere! -[laughing]
-[Danny] All day, every day. -Hell yes!
-[Danny] She's a beauty. -[Cal] That is a pretty fish!
[Steven] Man, it really is.
See, Callaghan, what you can do if you put your mind to it?
translation.ko: 캘러헌, 이걸 보니 무슨 생각이 들어?

translation.en: [Cal] You're a hell of a role model, Steve.
Perseverance.
[Steven] Stick to your guns, kids. You'll be so happy when it pays off.
translation.ko: 어린이 여러분, 포기하지 마세요 성공의 열매는 달콤하니까요

translation.en: After a couple of days of fishing,
it's time to relax and enjoy some fish cleaning and fish eating.
translation.ko: 이제는 여유롭게 생선을 손질하고 먹을 차례입니다

translation.en: It's a great opportunity to pick up new tricks.
I've cleaned boatloads of fish, just never a wahoo.
translation.ko: 지금껏 수많은 생선을 손질했지만 꼬치삼치는 처음입니다

translation.en: So you just come up around there?
See, what I do is I'll come here and I'll just get enough to get through the skin.
translation.ko: 저는 주로 이쯤부터 살짝 칼집을 낸 다음

translation.en: We're gonna peel the skin off.
-Oh, really? -Yeah.
-Okay, so start your classic filet cut-- -Yeah, exactly.
translation.ko: - 그래요, 평소에 이렇게 손질을… - 네, 맞아요

translation.en: Yeah, and run it up into the head there and run it all the way down.
translation.ko: 그렇죠, 머리 쪽으로 뺀 다음 저 아래까지 칼집을 내요

translation.en: -Just in a little ways? -[Danny] Mm-hmm.
There you go.
Yeah.
-[Steven] Go through now? -[Danny] I go right here.
-[imitates slicing] -[Steven] Oh, around there?
[Danny] Just cut that straight across.
Pretty good hide right there.
[Danny] Perfect.
[Cal] Just a big slab of meat.
Like that yield, Steve.
[Danny] A lot more compared to that goat, huh?
Oh, my goodness. [scoffs]
[Steven] I'm blown away by the size of these ono filets.
It makes me feel like we're cutting firewood.
-That's a fish right there! -[Cal] Yeah, that was a gorgeous fish.
translation.ko: - 이 정도는 돼야 물고기지 - 맞아, 정말 멋진 물고기야

translation.en: [Steven] And, man, they are gorgeous.
Then it's on to that elusive uku.
-Pretty girthy fish, huh? -[Steven] Mm-hmm.
[Danny] We put a lot of effort into that fish right there. -I'm glad it's sitting there now. -[Steven] Mm-hmm.
translation.ko: 힘들게 낚은 녀석이잖아요 이렇게 잡아서 정말 기뻐요

translation.en: [Danny] I was kind of starting to doubt it was gonna happen.
translation.ko: 이러다 못 잡는 건 아닌지 불안해질 때 잡혔어요

translation.en: -[Cal] Gorgeous. -[Danny] Yeah.
[Steven] And don't forget about our goat meat, which I'm very curious to try.
translation.ko: 염소 고기도 잊으시면 안 됩니다 저는 맛이 매우 궁금하거든요

translation.en: It doesn't smell like something that should be shunned.
[Steven] Cal is cooking up a traditional Island favorite, curried goat.
translation.ko: 캘은 섬사람들이 예전부터 먹은 염소 카레를 만들고 있습니다

translation.en: A hearty stew with ginger, carrots, potatoes, a heaping of yellow curry
translation.ko: 생강, 당근, 감자에 노란 카레를 넉넉히 넣고

translation.en: and some cream to hold it all together.
[Cal] Oh, yeah, this is gonna be great. She is looking good.
[Steven] While the goat simmers, Danny grabs one of those ono filets.
translation.ko: 염소 고기가 끓는 동안 대니는 오노 살코기를 집었습니다

translation.en: To really appreciate this beautiful fish, he's gonna slice up some sashimi.
translation.ko: 좋은 고기를 제대로 맛봐야 하니 이 부분은 회로 칠 겁니다

translation.en: -You made that knife too? -[Danny] Mm-hmm.
Yeah, it's just a horse rasp.
That's cool.
Here's Danny's chef's knife, made from a file used by farriers
translation.ko: 대니의 요리용 칼입니다 편자공들이 말발굽을 박기 전

translation.en: to shape a horse's hoof before shoeing.
translation.ko: 모양을 잡을 때 쓰던 쇠붙이로 만들었죠

translation.en: How often are you doing sashimi with ono?
[Danny] Um, maybe a third of the time.
translation.ko: 세 번 중에 한 번 정도 되지

translation.en: Most of the time I'm just frying it up or make a ceviche, but--
You have so much, you just use it like a food.
[Danny] Yeah, I mean, usually, like, I'll save the sashimi for tuna, for ahi.
translation.ko: 네, 보통 회로 먹는 건 참치나 눈다랑어죠

translation.en: [Cal] Yeah.
[Danny] Yeah. It's tender meat, though.
-[Steven laughs] That is cool, man. -[Cal] It is cool.
[Steven] Just a little soy sauce and wasabi is all you really need.
-Cal, go ahead. -[Cal] Yeah.
A lot of uniformity and a lot of versatility.
Yeah, it's this really slick and-- not oily, but oily, like a texture.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 윤기가 흐르고 느끼하진 않은데 식감이 기름져요

translation.en: [Cal] Yeah.
[Danny] That's pretty good, huh?
[Steven] Aw, man, if I lived here, I don't think I'd ever hunt again.
translation.ko: 제가 여기 살면 사냥은 그만두고 낚시만 다닐 것 같아요

translation.en: -I'd just fish. -[Danny] Yeah.
translation.ko: 제가 여기 살면 사냥은 그만두고 낚시만 다닐 것 같아요 그래요

translation.en: [Steven] Next, Danny takes another big piece and dices it up to make a Hawaiian ceviche,
translation.ko: 다음으로는 고기를 깍둑썰어서 하와이식 세비체로 만들었습니다

translation.en: with onion, cilantro, some fresh mango
and lime juice.
Then for that uku, he's just gonna give it a very light sear,
translation.ko: 그리고 우쿠 고기는 겉면만 살짝 익힌 다음

translation.en: slice it thin and then drizzle a fresh, zesty sauce on top.
translation.ko: 얇게 썰어서 상큼한 소스를 위에 올렸습니다

translation.en: All that's left now is the eating.
-You're up first, Steve-o. -Really?
Yeah, that's-- that's you right there.
-That was your obsession. -Catcher gets first taste. -[Danny] That was your obsession. -Yeah.
translation.ko: - '잡은 사람이 먼저 먹는다' - 잡고 싶어 했잖아요

translation.en: You know, it's like meatier than the wahoo.
-Yeah. -You know?
It's less mysterious.
It's more like, "Oh, yeah, man!"
-[Danny] Hmm. -[Steven] Good fish.
-Oh, yeah. -That's really something.
[Cal] You can tell why that's a prized fish.
-Thanks for catching it, Steve. -[Steven] These are good.
[Cal] Persistence pays off on the uku.
translation.ko: - 인내는 쓰지만 열매는 달군 - 정말 그래

translation.en: Man, your guys' fish are so good.
We catch a lot of fish that people are, "What do you do with that fish?"
translation.ko: 사람들은 우리가 잡는 걸 보고 '그걸 어디에 써?'라고 하는데

translation.en: -Well, you fry that fish. -[chuckling]
translation.ko: 사람들은 우리가 잡는 걸 보고 '그걸 어디에 써?'라고 하는데 튀기면 돼요 옥수숫가루 묻혀서 튀기세요

translation.en: Cornmeal and throw it in the fryer.
-Which I love. -Yeah. [Steven] But I'm, like, almost moved to tears by this thing.
translation.ko: 저는 그거 좋아하는데 이건 눈물이 날 만큼 맛있네요

translation.en: Ceviche's good. It's sweet too with the mango.
translation.ko: 세비체 맛있죠 망고가 들어가서 단맛도 있고요

translation.en: [Cal] Good ceviche.
[Steven] So clean tasting.
-That's an incredible fish, man. -[Danny] Yeah.
You ready to compare it to an old nanny goat?
translation.ko: 나이 많은 암컷 염소 고기랑 비교할 준비 됐어?

translation.en: I'll-- I'll give it its due.
[Cal] A good curry is nothing to pass up.
translation.ko: 맛있는 카레는 그냥 넘어갈 수 없잖아

translation.en: [Steven] Hmm. It's good.
